oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Department of Energy Photograph Collection
Gamble Valley Boy Scouts hold campfire
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Assembled around a campfire, a group of boys and two men watch as one boy works with a length of rope.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Boy Scouts of America (Oak Ridge, Tenn.); Boys; Campfires; Gamble Valley neighborhood (Oak Ridge, Tenn.)

Ayers, Harrison Gulden; Carter, Gene Allen; Dean, Thomas Jefferson; DeHart, Harold Ray; Fabris, Frank; Holden, Richard; Layne, Bonnie; Nutt, John; Nutt, Thomas Ed; Peoples, Lawrence J.; Rodgers, Kenneth; Rowley, Brock; Stark, Ray; Swan, Robert LeRoy; Tallent, Robert; Viator, Harry; Whitney, Ira B.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: See Oak Ridge Journal of September 14, 1944. Left to right around the fire: Ira B. Whitney, Boy Scout Commissioner; Robert LeRoy Swan, Lawrence J. Peoples, Thomas Jefferson Dean, Thomas Ed Nutt, Harry Viator, John Nutt, Richard Holden, Frank Fabris, Brock Rowley, Robert Tallent, Ray Stark, Bonnie Layne, Harold Ray DeHart, Kenneth Rodgers, Harrison Gulden Ayers and Gene Allen Carter.
PRO 7; 9-5-1944; Boy Scouts-Gamble Valley Picnic Grounds
